article.title: Real-Time Trajectory Replanning for MAVs using Uniform B-splines and a 3D Circular Buffer

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of curve is used to represent the local trajectory in this figure?
choices: BÃ©zier curve
Catmull-Rom spline
Uniform B-spline
Polynomial spline

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the primary advantage of using a circular buffer for local occupancy mapping compared to an octomap, as shown in this figure?
choices: Circular buffers can map larger environments.
Circular buffers result in smoother occupancy representations.
Circular buffers offer significantly faster insertion times for point cloud measurements.
Circular buffers provide more accurate distance information for collision checking.

multiple_choice_question.text: What aspect of the proposed optimization objective is demonstrated in this figure, where the local trajectory avoids the obstacle while rejoining the global trajectory?
choices: The ability to enforce hard constraints on the control points.
The use of soft constraints to balance obstacle avoidance with following the global path.
The superior performance of B-splines compared to polynomial splines in terms of computation time.
The effectiveness of using a fixed number of control points for trajectory optimization.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the primary sensor used for obstacle mapping in this real-world experiment?
choices: Stereo camera only
Lidar only
Both stereo camera and RGB-D camera
Monocular camera with depth estimation

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of the soft limit cost function, as visualized in this figure, in the trajectory optimization process?
choices: To penalize deviations from the desired position and velocity at the end of the trajectory segment.
To calculate the integral over the squared derivatives of the trajectory, such as acceleration and jerk.
To determine the distance to the nearest obstacle for each point along the trajectory.
To ensure that the calculated trajectory remains feasible by bounding the velocity, acceleration, jerk, and snap.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of using a ground-truth octomap forest model in this simulation, as opposed to relying solely on the drone\'s sensor measurements?
choices: To improve the computational efficiency of the simulation.
To provide a visual reference and allow for a comparison between the planned trajectory and the true environment.
To compensate for the limited accuracy of the simulated RGB-D camera.
To generate a more realistic global trajectory for the drone to follow.
